TITLE: As Biden faces questions about his age, researchers weigh in on working in your 80s
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden's age is less of an anomaly than a sign of the times, experts say. Workers 75 and older are the fastest-growing labor market age group.

TITLE: The future of EVs in the collectible cars market, from the Tesla Roadster to BMWs and Ferraris
SUMMARY: Elon Musk used to say EVs would increase in value after purchase. That's not happening, but the original Tesla Roadster is getting attention from collectors.

TITLE: Biden proposes $10,000 tax breaks for first-time homebuyers, 'starter home' sellers
SUMMARY: President Biden has proposed a new first-time homebuyer tax credit.

TITLE: Biden vows to protect Social Security, Medicare and 'make the wealthy pay their fair share,' in State of the Union
SUMMARY: During the State of the Union on Thursday, President Joe Biden said he opposes Social Security and Medicare benefit cuts, as well as raising the retirement age.

TITLE: Biden touts 'fixed' student loan forgiveness programs in State of the Union. Here's what he meant
SUMMARY: In his State of the Union address, President Joe Biden spoke about his work to forgive the student debt of nearly 4 million people. Here's what to know.

SUMMARY: Economists weigh in on Biden's comments about inflation in his State of the Union address.

TITLE: Op-ed: Financial fraud targets older adults, especially women. How to recognize and prevent it
SUMMARY: In an increasingly digital world, the specter of financial fraud looms large, especially for older adults, and older women are more likely to be victims.

TITLE: Why gas is so expensive in California
SUMMARY: California has some of the highest gas prices in the United States. Here's what's driving gas prices higher and how drivers can save at the pump.

TITLE: Trump vs. Biden: What a presidential election rematch could mean for your taxes
SUMMARY: With looming tax law changes slated for after 2025, President Joe Biden or former President Donald Trump would face several expiring tax provisions.

TITLE: Bailing on the stock market during volatility is a ‘loser’s game,' financial advisor says. Here's why
SUMMARY: Getting out of the stock market during periods of volatility may feel safer. But the math suggests investors often sacrifice big returns.

TITLE: 'Consumers should not worry' after turbulent month for New York Community Bank, former FDIC chair says
SUMMARY: A turbulent month for New York Community Bank has prompted some customers to pull their deposits. But most consumers do not have to worry, experts say.

TITLE: Op-ed: Target-date funds can be 'a mixed bag' for investors. Here's why
SUMMARY: Target-date funds can be a handy tool to make retirement planning easier. Yet, they aren't a cure-all for everyone.

SUMMARY: President Joe Biden called for protecting Social Security and Medicare in last year's State of the Union. This year, advocates hope to see action.

TITLE: How to know when married filing separately makes sense, according to tax experts
SUMMARY: Married couples can choose to file taxes jointly or separately every year. Here's how to pick the best option.

TITLE: Don't be enticed by the gold rally, expert says: Investors 'buy gold and hope it doesn't go up'
SUMMARY: Gold does well when other assets — and the world, are in trouble. And so even those who join the rally should root against the yellow metal, experts say.

TITLE: What the SEC vote on climate disclosures means for investors
SUMMARY: The rule passed in a 3-2 vote but is watered down from the initial version proposed in March 2022.

TITLE: As late, missed payments rise, credit card borrowers face 'consequences' for falling behind, CFPB says
SUMMARY: The CFPB finalized a rule to ban excessive credit card late fees, after finding that cardholders paid a record $130 billion in interest and fees.

TITLE: Credit scores decrease for the first time in a decade as more borrowers fall behind on payments
SUMMARY: The national average credit score slipped for the first time in a decade, driven by increases in missed borrower payments, according to FICO.

TITLE: The job more parents are taking to get a discount on their kids' college tuition
SUMMARY: With the average cost of private college education above $40,000 annually, more parents are going to work for schools as a way to qualify for discounts.

TITLE: Self-made millionaire Vivian Tu went from 'scrimping and saving' to creating wealth with this mindset shift
SUMMARY: Building wealth can be more difficult for women facing challenges such as lower wages. Here's how self-made millionaire Vivian Tu created wealth.

SUMMARY: Women make less money than men and live longer, which can dim their odds for a financially secure retirement, experts said.

TITLE: In poker, risk is the 'name of the game,' pro player says. How that applies to women and investing
SUMMARY: Women may be reluctant to take financial risks. But to take calculated chances that pay off, a mix of data and gut instincts can help, a pro poker player says.

SUMMARY: Many women today are looking for "financial peace," said Jean Chatzky, founder and CEO of HerMoney. Here's how they can achieve it, experts say.

SUMMARY: For women, achieving financial success requires stepping out of our comfort zone, says Bola Sokunbi, founder of Clever Girl Finance.

SUMMARY: After suffering a blow to its brand, Harvard is back on top as this year’s dream school, according to a new survey of college-bound students.

SUMMARY: Many Americans agree that the nation is facing a retirement crisis, a new study finds. But young workers may be in luck, since they have time on their side.

SUMMARY: Venture capital funding for companies founded by women has been trending up. Incubators for women founders and more new companies founded by women have helped.
